summary: Over 7,000 veterans have used a Veterans Affairs' Rogers STEM scholarship to pursue degrees in science, technology, engineering, and math. VA provides some training and guidance to help its staff process scholarship applications. But some STEM majors—like engineering and math—are easier to identify than others. Using VA data, we found over 100 instances where it appeared VA approved the scholarships for non-STEM majors. VA confirmed...
title: Higher Education: VA Should Provide Additional Information to Its Staff and Schools on the Rogers STEM Scholarship
topics: Science, Technology, Engineering, and Mathematics programs
